abstract: Study published in JAMA finds that breast biopsies are accurate for telling difference between healthy tissue and cancer, but less reliable for identifying more subtle abnormalities; researchers say because of uncertainty, women whose results fall into gray area between normal and malignant should get second opinions on their biopsies.
lead_paragraph: Breast biopsies are good at telling the difference between healthy tissue and cancer, but less reliable for identifying more subtle abnormalities, a new study finds.

headline.main: Breast Biopsies Leave Room for Doubt, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Breast Biopsies Not Foolproof, Study Cautions

snippet: Breast biopsies are good at telling the difference between healthy tissue and cancer, but less reliable for identifying more subtle abnormalities, a new study finds.

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations
